Material used.Description: siRNA was used to knockdown DJ-1, and plasmids were used for over-expression of wild-type and L166P mutant DJ-1 in neuronal cells.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P mutant DJ-1 failed to rescue cell death under oxidative stress compared to wild-type DJ-1.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated in triplicate across different cell cultures.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experimental condition was tested in triplicate per biological replicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 over-expression was used as a positive control for rescue assays.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection was used as a negative control for over-expression.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA and post-hoc tests were used for multiple group comparisons.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability greater than 80% compared to control under stress conditions.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cell viability less than 50% compared to control under stress conditions.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Cell Viability Assay under Stress Conditions

Material used.Description: Cells were exposed to hydrogen peroxide (oxidative stress), ER stress agents, and proteasome inhibitors to assess viability.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P mutant DJ-1 showed significantly reduced protection against oxidative stress-induced cell death.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated in triplicate across different cell cultures.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experimental condition was tested in triplicate per biological replicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Untreated cells were used as a positive control for baseline viability.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells treated with a non-specific stress agent were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: t-test was used for pairwise comparisons between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability greater than 80% compared to untreated cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cell viability less than 50% compared to untreated cells.
